data.title: How to use new intellisense engine properly?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-53-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.16|
|tslint|eg2|0.16.0|
|language-haskell|justusadam|2.2.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.12.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.6|
|cmake|twxs|0.0.17|
|cmake-tools|vector-of-bool|0.10.1|
|debug|webfreak|0.20.0|
|c-cpp-snippets|wlhe|0.1.0|;


---

After reading [an announcement](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vcblog/2017/06/27/visual-studio-code-cc-extension-june-2017-update/) I immediately ran to my computer to try it out. But I was very disappointed finding that I don't know how to enable the new engine. I added line `"C_Cpp.intelliSenseEngine": "Default"` to `settings.json` but still I have a garbage in autocompletion list - it suggests my hundreds of items, not related to my class, as before.

data.title: VS Code forgets previous shortcut filters
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: any
- OS Version: mac os

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select menu code/preferences/shortcuts
2. enter something to filter shortcuts. Example: duplicate lnes
3. change tabs
4. VS code forgets previous filters

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Expected: keep previous data and filter entered by the user.

data.title: Auto indenting is all over the place, should respect settings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (954193248183c7bb4d70c89898bc5337ce57fe98, 2017-06-29T05:16:56.386Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

This is a pretty obvious bug, but of all the indent-related issues, I'm not quite sure if any match. Nearest matches are probably #25253 and #29472. As usual I'll probably find the main issue after submitting as well, but here is me editing a TypeScript file:

![autoindent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1007463/27684318-68b54a42-5c7e-11e7-8f1b-dbc7e980daa3.gif)

Steps to reproduce:

1. Keep pressing enter a few times.
2. Press backspace. Repeatedly.

![trim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1007463/27684672-ca4810a4-5c7f-11e7-9b68-f5a1085cbb43.gif)

Steps to reproduce:

1. Press enter twice.
2. Up arrow once.

Related settings:
- "editor.formatOnType": false
- "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true

data.title: Smoke Test Dev Review
data.body:
It would be great if each of you can familiarise yourself with smoke test area that you are responsible of (this involves code review, general automated smoke test operation). Smoke test areas are defined as here - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test.

This is required to ensure we reduce any potential flaws in our smoke tests. Moreover, going further you may need to implement some tests if you add new feature to VS Code, or redesign some of existing smoke test parts due to any UI changes. Hence, it is important that you are familiar with the way automated smoke test is working now.

Here is a general readme on the code - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/tree/master/test/smoke.

When reviewing your area make sure you understand:
- Code architecture
- What to do when smoke test fails (looking it up on VSTS website, downloading test artifacts after build has finished, debugging)
- Weak points

Also think of the way you would improve the smoke test, and write your thoughts here. Please check yourself off once you became familiar with it.
  - [ ] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [ ] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar
  - [ ] @dbaeumer
  - [x] @bpasero
  - [x] @egamma
  - [ ] @isidorn
  - [x] @joaomoreno
  - [x] @jrieken
  - [ ] @kieferrm
  - [ ] @aeschli
  - [ ] @rebornix
  - [ ] @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] @roblourens
  - [ ] @sandy081
  - [ ] @mjbvz

All feedback is welcome and appreciated, skepticism should be transformed into suggestions together with contribution to automated smoke test implementation, ensuring it is always reliable! 🙂

2. search file that has similar names
3. order of the search may come back in an insane order

data.title: Dismiss the diff review panel when the diff editor gets focus
data.body:
* bring up the diff review panel (via F7)
* press F1
* press Escape
* The focus is now in the diff editor that sits behind the diff review panel

The diff review panel should be closed.

data.title: Move Task API from proposed to final.
Guiding new users on settings change in settings UI
data.body:
Follow up on #28463 on guiding how to change settings for new users. 

We can go for several options:
1. Show notification box for new users with the same text ("DEFAULT SETTINGS: Place your settings in the file to the right to overwrite") as currently under search bar.
2. Make this text as a separate bar underneath search, with ability to close it with `x` button, as in peek widgets.

As soon as notification is closed, as a user I should not see this information any more (assumption is that I became educated on how to change settings)

I would personally prefer the second option, because top notifications are usually too annoying.

data.title: Unnecessary indentation in JS when line starts with semicolon
data.body:
If I have JS code like this and save the file, because I've got automatic formatting on save enabled it will indent the second line (because it starts with a semicolon), which should not happen.

```js
const a = 'b'
;(() => { console.log('c') })()
```

data.title: Linux: File watcher does not report the very first deletes for me

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have the VSCode folder opened on Ubuntu Linux 17
2. I delete a top level file or folder using the native Ubuntu explorer ("Move to Trash")

=> nothing happens in the explorer
=> no event is generated

3. I delete another file

=> now the events show up, even for the first file

Proof:

![panel-red](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/27672487-960b8d04-5c9b-11e7-8b27-4b71864389b1.gif)


Works fine with the experimental watcher disabled.
